Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbonauts

On my YouTube channel I'm thinking about starting a video series where I showcase peoples craft. The only rule, is that it has to be stock. To send this craft to me, just post the craft file and photos here. Also, if it is a difficult craft to fly, give me some flying instructions. Videos are recorded whenever I can, and then I will post the links here, and tag the person who I made it for. I'll make sure to put your forum name, a link to this page, and a link to your forum page, in the description of my videos. If anybody is interested, leave it down below! I am also willing to do revisits, if something changed. Thanks!

I've always wanted to do a video of my space stations and their construction, but never had the time and know-how.  Maybe one of them will work for you?    Try this one:  All-in-One-MK2-Flight Station

They are all stock and available on KerbalX (see my signature link).
This might be best in Fanworks, I hope you can find some craft for your vids MacGamer.
I'm building a rocket-only spaceplane with mining kit included, I'll past it to ya when I know the ascent path and how much fuel is left in orbit.

I have seen a lot of these type of threads blow up, usually because someone gave someone else a bad review. I would be very selective and do not show a craft if you think it is bad and do not promise to review peoples craft. There are people here who think they deserve awe and admiration and will post a link to their thread and then blow up when you don't do anything with their submission which probably didn't even obey the rules in the first place. If I was you I would put some rules in place straight away like the Spacecraft Fridays thread (and some people have blown up at that when their genius was not immediately recognised) and make sure every submission gets a reply with those rules. In fact a good place to start would be to just video review the craft featured in Spacecraft Fridays (with the caveats already mentioned) then you don't even need submissions.

 

Whew, just trying to save you having your thread locked later.

So with that in mind, here is my submission the Blue Origin New Shepard, first the Album

 This is the release forum thread, flying instructions are in there, you can get the craft from below

Download

Best of luck with your video series, I thought of doing one but don't have the time, but I can help out a little if you need something.

Cheers,

SM

Edited December 2, 2015 by selfish_meme

Thanks everybody for doing submissions, and giving me some advice. I'm generally an honest person when it comes to reviews, and I will have these videos recorded and posted ASAP. Selfish_Meme, the text on you KerbalX page covers the download button, so I can't download your craft...umm this is a problem do you think you could fix it?

 

Edited December 4, 2015 by MacGamer04
MacGamer04, look at the top right of his KerbalX page.  There should be a download link there as well.

5 hours ago, StormKat said:

MacGamer04, look at the top right of his KerbalX page.  There should be a download link there as well.

I looked there as well. Nothing there :(

Here's a direct link to the file:  New Shepard craft

Maybe that will work.

On December 5, 2015 at 8:51:17 AM, StormKat said:

Here's a direct link to the file:  New Shepard craft

Maybe that will work.

Yup, that one worked. Thanks so much :)
